thread.title: Pumpkin Patches Kansas City

title: Pumpkin Patches Kansas City
text:
By Mary Anne McNeish Updated February 22, 2016 . 
With Fall offically here, it's time for Kansas Citians to head out to one of the many pumpkins patches around the metro. Farms all over the KC have oodles of pumpkins available for pickin' once fall rolls around. Sort through piles of pumpkins or head out to the patch to pick your own. Hop aboard a railroad, take a hayride, make your way though a corn maze, pet farm animals and enjoy all the fun things that come with fall. 
Times, prices and dates are subject to change, PLEASE call before you go! 1. Carolyn's Country Cousins 
Carolyn's Country Cousins is Kansas City's 'mega patch' which is so big you can spend the whole day there--making it the KC Guide's Top Pick. With thousands of pumpkins, 50 acre U-pick patch, huge corn maze, Little Bud's Railroad, petting zoo, playground, and activites all day long, Carolyns Country Cousins is an extravaganza not to be missed. 17607 NE 52nd St, Liberty, MO (intersection of 291 and 210) 816.781.9196
